name: Trivial Stuff 5 Trivia Game | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What state has the most seats in the U.S. House of Representatives?
questions.explanation:
California.

	California has 53 seats in U.S. House of Representatives.  New York has 27, Texas has 36 and Pennsylvania has 18.

questions.text: Who won the Silver Medal for women's figure skating at the 1994 Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation:
Nancy Kerrigan.

	In Women's Figure Skating at the Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway, Oksana Baiul from the Ukraine won the Gold Medal, Nancy Kerrigan from the U.S. won the Silver and Chen Lu from China won the Bronze.

questions.text: If you were drinking something and it was "brackish", what would that mean?
questions.explanation:
It was slightly salty.

	Brackish is derived from the Dutch word 'brac' which means salty.

questions.text: What do the letters 'C' and 'A' stand for in YMCA?
questions.explanation:
Christian Association.

	The Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) was founded in 1844 in London, England by George Williams.

questions.text: What is the last word spoken in the movie "Gone With the Wind"?
questions.explanation:
Day.

	Written by Margaret Mitchell in 1936 it was adapted to the big screen in 1939.  The last words spoken in the movie (and book) were "After all, tomorrow is another day."

questions.text: If you suddenly have neurapraxia, what is wrong with you?
questions.explanation:
numbness.

	When a nerve is compressed between a bone and another hard object, that part of the body will "fall asleep" and cause temporary numbness.

questions.text: In how many movies did Basil Rathbone star as Sherlock Holmes?
questions.explanation:
14.

	His first movie, as the fictional detective Sherlock Holmes, was in "The Hound of the Baskervilles" in 1939.  His last movie as Mr. Holmes was "Dressed to Kill" in 1946.

questions.text: The Baby Ruth candy bar was named after baseballer Babe Ruth.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Even though it would seem logical, it isn't true.  The candy bar was named for Presdident Grover Cleveland's oldest daughter, Ruth.

Francis Bellamy.

	Written in 1892 to commemorate Columbus Day.

questions.text: What Disney movie was inspired by a fairy tale by author Charles Perrault?
questions.explanation:
Cinderella.

	Charles Perrault also wrote a fairy tale that was the inspiration for another Disney classic movie, "Sleeping Beauty".
